basics.name: Conner Stevons
basics.label: Physicist/Electrical Engineer
basics.summary: My technical background lies in physics and electrical engineering, with a focus on quantum physics and optics. My educational journey was driven by a genuine interest in fundamental science, fueled by a deep passion for learning and tackling complex concepts that explain the world around us. As I transitioned into the workforce, I discovered a strong passion for data science, particularly in machine and deep learning. I have quickly established a solid foundation in this field by developing and measuring the performance of classic supervised and unsupervised machine learning models in my current position at General Dynamics Mission Systems. This evolving interest has inspired me to pursue a career in machine learning and further my education by applying for Ph.D. programs in Fall 2024.

courses: Concurrent Activities: Academic grader; 1 Summer Internship with NASA Glenn Research Center; Temporary Research Assitant at the School of Information

Courses Taken: Machine/Deep Learning, Nonlinear Optics, Optical Waves through Crystals, Quantum Optics, Applied Quantum Mechanics, Electron Microscopy, Lasers, Adv. Lasers Lab, Semiconductor Lasers and LEDs, Classical Optics
Concurrent Activities: Graduate Teaching and Research Assistant; 1 Summer Internship with NASA Glenn Research Center

Courses Taken: Statistical Mechanics, Fourier Optics, Classical Mechanics, Quantum Mechanics, Mathematical & Statistical Methods, Partial Differential Equations, Laser Physics, Lasers Lab, Physical Optics, Light Scattering by Particles, General Relativity
Graduated with honors status and Summa Cum Laude

work.name: General Dynamics Mission Systems
highlights: Secured 1 patent submission and 3 Engineering Excellence awards
Written and maintained repositories of 100+ Python and MATLAB scripts for data processing, machine learning, and data visualization tasks
Developed Python AI/ML models for clustering and classification tasks with accompanying performance metrics/visualizations
Experienced technical speaker in dozens of customer and internal presentations
Designed and performed lab experiments for Rydberg Atom RF sensors as well as fiber-based quantum communications technology

work.name: NASA Glenn Research Center (GRC)
highlights: Developed MATLAB code to model the efficiency of electro‑optical devices for entangled photon generation
Simulated and designed an interactive optical frequency comb generator in MATLAB, with the assumption of CW laser light
Published whitepapers and presented research results at the NASA Quantum Information Science Conference and to NASA leadership
Collaborated with teams of NASA researchers, interns, and even astronauts across multiple centers

work.name: University of Alabama in Huntsville, Dept. of Physics
highlights: Taught 10 physics lab courses, mentoring and collaborating with hundreds of students, and enhancing their understanding and application of physics concepts and analysis
Applied research and academic knowledge to successfully capture funding to perform a quantum optics research project
Led scientific outreach events at 2 North Alabama Regional Science Olympiads for middle and high school students
Passed the UAH Physics Comprehension Examination at the Ph.D. level

Prepared experiments using optical lab skills such as free‑space alignment; manipulating optical polarization; beam focusing; generating diffraction patterns with gratings and spatial light modulators, and building various interferometers

items: PyTorch, Scikit-Learn, Pandas, NumPy, Plotly, Seaborn, Matpotlib, TensorFlow, FiftyOne
Teaching, Critical/Deep Thinking, Leadership, Persistant Learner, Thoughtful Listener

awards.title: Eagle Scout
awards.summary: The highest achievable rank in the Boy Scouts. Eagle Scouts demonstrate elevated abilities in leadership, service, and preparedness in their line of work and local community. My Eagle Scout project was beautifying the grounds of a local church via planting 5, 300-lb trees and extensive mulching.

awards.title: Engineering Excellence at GDMS
awards.summary: Awarded 1 patent and 3 Engineering Excellence Awards. These awards are given out to engineers that display outstanding abilities and promise in their respective programs/projects.
